bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. MYRICK:H.R. 4603.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 1, Section 8 of Article 1 of the United StatesConstitution which reads:``The Congress shall have Power to lay and collect Taxes,Duties, Imposts, and Excises, to pay the Debts, and providefor the common Defense and General Welfare of the UnitedStates; but all Duties and Imposts and Excises shall beuniform throughout the United States.'[Page H2071]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text: Amends the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States to extend the suspension of duty on staple fibers of viscose rayon, not carded, combed, or otherwise processed for spinning.

bill.title: To extend the suspension of duty on staple fibers of viscose rayon, not carded, combed, or otherwise processed for spinning.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
